title: Hair Comb
description: To pull a comb like this through your hair was to sweep across cultures in a single gesture, a reflection of 19th-century Zanzibar, then the cosmopolitan capital of the Omani Emirate, host to a United States consul, and a bustling harbor to ships from around the world. The lucky Zanzibari woman who received it as a wedding gift undoubtedly identified as Swahili, a cultural melting pot stretching along the East African coast from Somalia to Mozambique, and parts of Madagascar, with roots in Africa, Arabia, Persia and India.
